summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY) regarding scheduling a proffer session about Jeffrey Epstein's financial relationship with a bank. The proffer aims to guide prosecutors through bank records and transactions related to Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Parvin Daphne Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Primary correspondent representing the bank (likely JPMorgan Chase) in responding to a subpoena from the SDNY regarding Jeffrey Epstein's accounts. She proposes and coordinates a proffer session to explain Epstein's relationship with the bank and highlight notable transactions.

persons.name: Moyer, Thomas
persons.role: Attorney (likely at Akin Gump or associated with the bank)
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, involved in the coordination of the proffer session regarding the bank's production of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the financial investigation. The emails discuss a proffer to explain his relationship with the bank and review transactions from his accounts.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in the same legal matter, coordinating a response to a subpoena regarding Jeffrey Epstein's bank records. They are copied on the same emails.
Moyne, representing the bank, is facilitating the production of Epstein's financial records and offering to explain his relationship with the bank to prosecutors.

events.title: Proposed Proffer Session
events.description: A proposed date for attorneys from Akin Gump and the bank to deliver a presentation to SDNY prosecutors about Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with the bank and transactions in his accounts.

locations: Florida (mentioned as a travel destination for team members)
One Bryant Park (Akin Gump office address)
keyFacts: Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP attorneys are coordinating with SDNY prosecutors to provide a proffer on Jeffrey Epstein's financial relationship with a bank (likely JPMorgan Chase).
The proffer aims to provide an overview of Epstein's accounts, transaction types, and highlight specific transactions noted in the bank's internal investigation.
The email chain shows an active financial investigation into Epstein by the SDNY in August 2019, following his arrest.
The correspondence indicates a cooperative but structured process, with the bank's attorneys seeking to guide prosecutors through a large volume of financial records.
